commit_message:
Add dns_db to models/head.py

commit 93ac8b3a3318c0b762d399fa78b8ce981d44b3d9 adds dns_db
but it forgot to add it to models/heads.
As a result, db migration model sync check is failing.

Closes-Bug: #1537578
Closes-Bug: #1537510

Note that it was not detected in our neutron functional tests.
It is being investigated in bug 1537510.

Change-Id: Ica15afb1fd2335e5fe686ec36b05513a46427bcd

commit_message:
Fix 'astara-ctl browse' can't rebuild router

When a router name doesn't startswith 'ak-', set the default tenant_id to '*'.

Change-Id: I8f907cc191b9816972003e5a2c8dbb35ac2deec9
Closes-bug: 1537500

subject: Use oslo.utils reflection and avoid refinding decorated name
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-25 20:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/profiler.py', 'requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Use oslo.utils reflection and avoid refinding decorated name

Instead of computing/finding the decorated function name using
a less robust function, use the one provided by oslo.utils which
is more robust.

Also at the same time, avoid refinding the function name every
single time the decorated function is called, as its needless to
do this once it has been completed once.

Change-Id: Id39a73ee80163dd930a5900d9631e3b8665e7a26
'}]
commit_message:
Use oslo.utils reflection and avoid refinding decorated name

Instead of computing/finding the decorated function name using
a less robust function, use the one provided by oslo.utils which
is more robust.

Also at the same time, avoid refinding the function name every
single time the decorated function is called, as its needless to
do this once it has been completed once.

Change-Id: Id39a73ee80163dd930a5900d9631e3b8665e7a26

subject: Complex soft (anti-)affinity policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 22:13:26.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/approved/complex-soft-anti-affinity-policies.rst'], 'message': 'Complex soft (anti-)affinity policies

To meet typical telecommunication service provider SLAs the failure
of any given host cannot take down more than k VMs in each N+k pool
for a given application. More precisely, given that the pools are
dynamically scaled, it is a requirement that at no time is there
more than a certain proportion of any pool instantiated on the same
host.

Change-Id: If457e3f6f60d475a1da1184092c8595c8312bf9f
'}]
commit_message:
Complex soft (anti-)affinity policies

To meet typical telecommunication service provider SLAs the failure
of any given host cannot take down more than k VMs in each N+k pool
for a given application. More precisely, given that the pools are
dynamically scaled, it is a requirement that at no time is there
more than a certain proportion of any pool instantiated on the same
host.

Change-Id: If457e3f6f60d475a1da1184092c8595c8312bf9f

subject: Use calendar.timegm not time.mktime
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 22:13:10.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_versioned_writes.py'], 'message': "Use calendar.timegm not time.mktime

time.mktime produces a POSIX timestamp that takes into account the local
timezone, but we're parsing a Last-Modified header with a known (GMT)
timezone. As a result, if one proxy-server is configured with a timezone
other than GMT/UTC, we may have previous versions in the wrong order.

Change-Id: I320e2368b243f4245725e73bfabc7ad19bc5bacb
"}]
commit_message:
Use calendar.timegm not time.mktime

time.mktime produces a POSIX timestamp that takes into account the local
timezone, but we're parsing a Last-Modified header with a known (GMT)
timezone. As a result, if one proxy-server is configured with a timezone
other than GMT/UTC, we may have previous versions in the wrong order.

Change-Id: I320e2368b243f4245725e73bfabc7ad19bc5bacb

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

subject: Fix buildimage job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 13:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['bin/manila-image-create', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix buildimage job

Job named "buildimage" fails with following error:

E: Package 'kpartx' has no installation candidate

So, execute "apt-get update" before required dependencies installation.
Also, do not install dependencies specified in 'test-requirements.txt'
as redundant.

Change-Id: Ic4beaa6be81eb50bafa1dd029722ec84288e6f20
Closes-Bug: #1537011
'}]
commit_message:
Fix buildimage job

Job named "buildimage" fails with following error:

E: Package 'kpartx' has no installation candidate

So, execute "apt-get update" before required dependencies installation.
Also, do not install dependencies specified in 'test-requirements.txt'
as redundant.

Change-Id: Ic4beaa6be81eb50bafa1dd029722ec84288e6f20
Closes-Bug: #1537011

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-16 18:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Remove run_tests.sh

Now Nova have deprecated run_tests.sh already and encourage
developer to use tox instead.
Details about why we should do this in [1].
One of the critical differences between it and
tox is that it lacks python hashseed randomization.
This runs every test run with a different forced hashseed,
that exposes bugs in tests early.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/2dc5d9f8632c83c9bc7ee6871c6631edf69a5570

Change-Id: I16388b8aa7a01cde09add2de9d5e1fbe449ca3ab
'}]
commit_message:
Remove run_tests.sh

Now Nova have deprecated run_tests.sh already and encourage
developer to use tox instead.
Details about why we should do this in [1].
One of the critical differences between it and
tox is that it lacks python hashseed randomization.
This runs every test run with a different forced hashseed,
that exposes bugs in tests early.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/2dc5d9f8632c83c9bc7ee6871c6631edf69a5570

Change-Id: I16388b8aa7a01cde09add2de9d5e1fbe449ca3ab

commit_message:

Sometimes json is not for everyone, having the (de)serializers
be provided allows people to replace those with other variations
as they choose.

commit_message:
Tweak MySQL logging configuration

For a galera replication we do not need binary logs, but we need binary logs in
case customer needs to perform MySQL backup. In this review we propose to limit
rotation period for 1 day, and set option to disable binary logging by default.

Change-Id: I001c87081a3b334eb8844abca60e468370ea5f24
Closes-Bug: #1533805
(cherry picked from commit 9660e49bdf8229418450c9a1151ab217d357a797)

commit_message:
Do not mock the memcache interface for auth_token

Use the new auth_token fixture from keystonemiddleware instead of
mocking the memcache interface itself. This will be less prone
to breaking down the line if internal structures change for
keystonemiddleware.auth_token.

Change-Id: I0c8dfb844de8817e1a9a56557030b7e9ce7b0bb8
Depends-On: If617556aa0b4e657f1bf95d4a73f7b9abdd34f90

subject: Install keystonemiddleware for source build swift proxy server
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 19:42:40.000000000', 'files': ['docker/openstack-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Install keystonemiddleware for source build swift proxy server

Swift doesn't have hard dependency on keystone authentication. Hence
keystonemiddleware is not listed in Keystone's requirements.txt. For
Kolla setup, since keystone is by default enabled, ensure
keystonemiddleware is correctly installed in proxy server Dockerfile.

Change-Id: Ie49433772d7ebe13b984dc0eb93840e6ca54a91a
Closes-Bug: #1537407
"}]
commit_message:
Install keystonemiddleware for source build swift proxy server

Swift doesn't have hard dependency on keystone authentication. Hence
keystonemiddleware is not listed in Keystone's requirements.txt. For
Kolla setup, since keystone is by default enabled, ensure
keystonemiddleware is correctly installed in proxy server Dockerfile.

Change-Id: Ie49433772d7ebe13b984dc0eb93840e6ca54a91a
Closes-Bug: #1537407

commit_message:
Increase kernel.pid_max value for ceph-osd nodes

To meet Ceph requirements and eliminate accidental cascade
OSD node failures this commit increases kernel.pid_max
parameter during deploy ceph-osd nodes. Also this commit
contain some puppet-lint cleanups and validations for this
module.

Change-Id: I70a64ff7b85229bf0760be266302d9b32039989a
(cherry-picked from commit 2cec77da86f2148a9e256bd46d58aaad2de874ea)
Closes-Bug: #1536271
Closes-Bug: #1537084

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-21 22:37:54.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/neutron_client.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/network/test_floatingip.py', 'ceilometer/network/floatingip.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/network/test_floating_ip.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-floatingip-pollster-f5172060c626b19e.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix ceilometer floatingip pollster

The existing floatingip pollster talks to nova api
to get the floatingip data. There are limitations
in nova api wrt returning this info for all the tenants
as stated in the bug#1402514. This patch changes
the pollster to use the neutron api to get this
data instead.

Considering this is a network related pollster and in most
cases network networking manages the floating ips now,
it makes sense to get this data from neutron.

Closes-Bug: #1536338

Change-Id: I372e3a85b34f90ff9aba842d9598b468f90fe94f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer floatingip pollster

The existing floatingip pollster talks to nova api
to get the floatingip data. There are limitations
in nova api wrt returning this info for all the tenants
as stated in the bug#1402514. This patch changes
the pollster to use the neutron api to get this
data instead.

Considering this is a network related pollster and in most
cases network networking manages the floating ips now,
it makes sense to get this data from neutron.

Closes-Bug: #1536338

Change-Id: I372e3a85b34f90ff9aba842d9598b468f90fe94f

commit_message:
Reduce bluebox max_servers from 39 to 0

Bluebox has some maintenance coming up. They would like us to
not be creating vms during their maintenance. This patch
reduces the number of bluebox max_servers from 39 to 0.

Change-Id: I410d48c3ee97c22e70afca8b32dfa91f83906b5d

subject: Stop ignoring v2password plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 19:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'message': 'Stop ignoring v2password plugin

We have no codepaths that currently set v2password plugin by default.
However, there are some cases, such as old clouds, where a user needs
to explicitly set v2password as the auth_type to avoid version discovery
because their cloud is old enough to not support it. If the user
sets v2password, keep it and align the auth parameters the other
direction to set tenant_name and tenant_id.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib9eb3ae163b79b67737d01868868187b6dee1756
'}]
commit_message:
Stop ignoring v2password plugin

We have no codepaths that currently set v2password plugin by default.
However, there are some cases, such as old clouds, where a user needs
to explicitly set v2password as the auth_type to avoid version discovery
because their cloud is old enough to not support it. If the user
sets v2password, keep it and align the auth parameters the other
direction to set tenant_name and tenant_id.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib9eb3ae163b79b67737d01868868187b6dee1756

to be public.

When a instance is running and has the windows metadata, the functionality
of creating a rdp file is provided as a action option. Once an action

Change-Id: I2fcc61cb1b88e6b5f86304821faeb1c658fcf5df

commit_message:
Generating a rdp file for a windows instance

When a instance is running and has the windows metadata, the functionality
of creating a rdp file is provided as a action option. Once an action
is selected, Horizon uploads to the user a rdp file with a public IP
associated to the instance. If none are found then it returns with the
first IP associated.

Change-Id: I2fcc61cb1b88e6b5f86304821faeb1c658fcf5df
Implements: blueprint download-windows-rdp-file
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-25 12:14:02.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/conf/__init__.py', 'horizon/exceptions.py', 'horizon/test/settings.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/rest/utils.py', 'openstack_dashboard/exceptions.py', 'horizon/conf/default.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py'], 'message': 'Refactoring the exceptions lists

The exception list is not properly used. The exception list is a
settings constant that can be modified within the settings file.  Having
the list in openstack_dashboard/exceptions.py confuses the
developers. The list of exceptions are moved in the settings file and
removed all duplications.

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability

Change-Id: Idccccf55a6d16d9d5e3b9a584fea5b26efd7a041
'}]
commit_message:
Refactoring the exceptions lists

The exception list is not properly used. The exception list is a
settings constant that can be modified within the settings file.  Having
the list in openstack_dashboard/exceptions.py confuses the
developers. The list of exceptions are moved in the settings file and
removed all duplications.

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-error-message-details-for-usability

Change-Id: Idccccf55a6d16d9d5e3b9a584fea5b26efd7a041

commit_message:
Add support for setting globally ms_bind_ipv6

When deploying with IPv6 we need to set ms_bind_ipv6 to true; this
change adds an option to set it globally as mixed environments are
not supported by Ceph.

Change-Id: I7c438d76dfcc0b58768a0896c3f50e97fa609a60

subject: Mark password/secret options as secret
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 23:54:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/generic.py'], 'message': "Mark password/secret options as secret

Password, token, and secret options should be marked as secret=True
so that when the value is logged the logger knows to obfuscate the
value.

Conflicts:
	keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/_loading.py
	keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v3.py

- There was no saml2 plugin in keystoneauth1.
- The OpenIDConnectPassword and OpenIDConnectAuthorizationCode
  plugins didn't exist.

Change-Id: I4818c4cc04cc6a4e1e3cf09d5e0b7b4ffefbb892
Closes-Bug: 1534299
(cherry picked from commit fcd9538eaf2b374ec5188426454a5c598621b902)
"}]
commit_message:
Mark password/secret options as secret

Password, token, and secret options should be marked as secret=True
so that when the value is logged the logger knows to obfuscate the
value.

Conflicts:
	keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/_loading.py
	keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v3.py

- There was no saml2 plugin in keystoneauth1.
- The OpenIDConnectPassword and OpenIDConnectAuthorizationCode
  plugins didn't exist.

Change-Id: I4818c4cc04cc6a4e1e3cf09d5e0b7b4ffefbb892
Closes-Bug: 1534299
(cherry picked from commit fcd9538eaf2b374ec5188426454a5c598621b902)

commit_message:
Clean up horizon.scss - _tables.scss

A major part of the css reorg is a better organization of the css
styles themselves. horizon.scss should be a global import level file.

Move remaining tables classes out of horizon.scss

Change-Id: I1d2b44eeaf365046b1265092f7819dc6c113cdb2
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

commit_message:
Use oslo.utils exception encoding util

Instead of using six.text_type (which may or may not work)
use the oslo.utils helper function that does a much more
through job of trying to get a valid exception message from
a provided exception.

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo config generation

- Defined "list_opts" method in relevant files.
- Defined a new config-generator.conf to drive the configurator.
- Added config entry points for "list_opts" to setup.cfg.
- Deleted the old generator script and the oslo incubator files.

Change-Id: I4bdbf4f6769fa7e02689bd24f3e4b3734502aa17
Closes-Bug: 1476839

subject: Minimal translation setup for murano-dashboard
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Minimal translation setup for murano-dashboard

Murano-dashboard is a dashboard for horizon, therefore shares the same
message structure as horizon does, i.e. django and djangojs .pot files.
Therefore this commit alters jenkins scripts, that update
translations, to include murano-dashboard where required.
However murano-dashboard (unlike horizon) does not use a shell file to
run it's tests, instead relying on tox.

This change does not actually run the jobs, we need to have a repo
for testing that the new consolidated setup works, so getting this in
helps with some manual testing.

Targets blueprint: murano-i18n

Change-Id: I7e8a620c12bcf47a908a4011976d1b148ee3e0dd
"}]
commit_message:
Minimal translation setup for murano-dashboard

Murano-dashboard is a dashboard for horizon, therefore shares the same
message structure as horizon does, i.e. django and djangojs .pot files.
Therefore this commit alters jenkins scripts, that update
translations, to include murano-dashboard where required.
However murano-dashboard (unlike horizon) does not use a shell file to
run it's tests, instead relying on tox.

This change does not actually run the jobs, we need to have a repo
for testing that the new consolidated setup works, so getting this in
helps with some manual testing.

Targets blueprint: murano-i18n

Change-Id: I7e8a620c12bcf47a908a4011976d1b148ee3e0dd

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

In case of new projects, the locale directory might not exist. Create it
so that the jobs do not fail.

commit_message:
Fix multiple bugs in puppet-oslo

This patch aims to make puppet-oslo work:
  - fix oslo::versionedobjects spec
  - fix oslo::policy
  - drop mock dependency
  - add acceptance by msync

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1492636

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I8e95e10fac4748b115838b6b480f1085da73f28a
Closes-bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Improve network delete 404 message

Instead of:
    $ os network delete bogus
    Not Found (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-4753d99d-9511-4851-9278-733c00d4ee38

Do something like:
    $ os network delete bogus
    Network not found: bogus
    $

Change-Id: I4f8a8a4a1c4fb8e9659e96c130d8260f3cfdb387

Until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158384/ is merged (and that's
currently blocked by some devstack issues that may take a while to be

commit_message:
Use keystone v3 with horizon by default

Until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158384/ is merged (and that's
currently blocked by some devstack issues that may take a while to be
sorted out), identity version in local_settings.py needs to be set to
3 explicitly, if we want to use Keystone v3 with Horizon. The second
part is setting url suffix in OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL parameter to
'/v3'.

commit_message:
Allow container template to recognize an update

The deployment resource looks for a change in name when
running an update.  If there is no change in containers,
docker will recognize that and the deployment will return.
If there is a new available container, docker will swap out
the old running container for a new one.

Change-Id: I60d45b5ef45714e6e0140dfc80c14d6a12701f32

commit_message:
Fix duplicate parameters and drop mock

This change removes the duplicate parameters from the main ironic class.
With the update to 3.8.5, this now shows up as a syntax error in the
syntax jobs. We should only define these parameters once.

Also mock is not used anywhere in the module, let's drop it.
This patch will help to hit this bug:
https://launchpad.net/bugs/1492636

Change-Id: Iaa6acafdc771118c74f85f3332f01b58d233743b
Closes-Bug: #1537251
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4dd2bff699dad3a29dddd778cf3e9a940e44a935)

commit_message:
homogenise resource type not found exceptions

A not existing resource type raise UnknownXXXx when
other object raise NoSuchXXXX.

This homogenises this by replacing UnknownResourceType by
NoSuchResourceType.

Change-Id: I31461608e1fb693051aa9f274898ecf0297a49f6

subject: Action plan state transition - payload validation
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-01-25 17:38:08.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/api/controllers/v1/action_plan.py', 'watcher/locale/watcher.pot', 'watcher/locale/fr/LC_MESSAGES/watcher.po', 'watcher/tests/api/v1/test_actions_plans.py', 'watcher/tests/applier/action_plan/__init__.py', 'watcher/tests/decision_engine/strategy/loading/__init__.py', 'watcher/tests/decision_engine/strategy/loading/test_default_strategy_loader.py'], 'message': "Action plan state transition - payload validation

This patchset fixes the lack of field validation that are provided
by an API user.

Via a PATCH on /action_plans, the only field that can be modified
is now the 'state'. This field can only perform to the following
state transitions:

- RECOMMENDED --> TRIGGERED
- RECOMMENDED --> CANCELLED
- ONGOING --> CANCELLED
- TRIGGERED --> CANCELLED

The DELETED state can only be set using a DELETE request.

Closes-Bug: #1531106
Change-Id: I6669cbe63407f0bbb792fb2e2ce6b1e8a7365238
"}]
commit_message:
Action plan state transition - payload validation

This patchset fixes the lack of field validation that are provided
by an API user.

Via a PATCH on /action_plans, the only field that can be modified
is now the 'state'. This field can only perform to the following
state transitions:

- RECOMMENDED --> TRIGGERED
- RECOMMENDED --> CANCELLED
- ONGOING --> CANCELLED
- TRIGGERED --> CANCELLED

The DELETED state can only be set using a DELETE request.

Closes-Bug: #1531106
Change-Id: I6669cbe63407f0bbb792fb2e2ce6b1e8a7365238

commit_message:
Remove lambda usage, fix pep8 E731 violation

Our pep8 is now checking E731 and failing.  This stops passing the  lambda
in questino around and instead just does the work in-line.

Change-Id: I47c44a559f5e912386a004bf7655732e13e844d3
(cherry picked from commit 9f9b7d0fde3cf34df49fbc903d08a551c9f7e086)

commit_message:
make gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full job voting

As per [1], the gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full job
has maintained a failure rate that trackes its single node
equivalent (gate-tempate-dsvm-neutron-full), so let's make it
a voting job.

[1] http://goo.gl/ff2Avv

Change-Id: Iec4ff4cb99cad5bf4de5f65b4ca6061696c219aa
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Check astute.yaml file was generated succesfully

Fuelmenu may not generate astute.yaml for some reason.
It may be crushing of fuelmenu or etc. To protect us of
this problem additional check has been introduced.

(cherry picked from commit 47d85af8994ea27b9dfcde30c59bfdf540cce5c9)

commit_message:
Replace yaml with fuelmenu module as yaml parser

This patch's mission is to wipe out unnecessary import from fuelmenu
module, in other case, these lines may be failed due to changes in
fuelmenu module and it will take a lot of effort to fast identify it.

Change-Id: Ib696846892fa3661c25d7e779392688c1240c553
Related-Bug: #1502110
(cherry picked from commit 6ef4d3940bbbfb45f0076efdf31e356d72862c20)

don't source openrc

source it as it prevents some ip math errors from randomly killing
tests.

If access to some attributes is forbidden (f.e. get_image_location

commit_message:
Allow image-list if access to attrs is forbidden

If access to some attributes is forbidden (f.e. get_image_location
policy is set to role:admin and user is not admin) glance should
just exclude these attributes from image-show, image-list output
instead of generating Forbidden exception.
Otherwise, the policies such as get_image_location is not useful.

APIImpact
SecurityImpact
Change-Id: I5a6f587086e926a1f7e9b3f1dac9d7e10710d72a
Closes-bug: #1502136

subject: Add properties_target to Instance SW metadefs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 00:29:49.000000000', 'files': ['etc/metadefs/software-runtimes.json', 'etc/metadefs/software-webservers.json', 'etc/metadefs/software-databases.json'], 'message': 'Add properties_target to Instance SW metadefs

There are several metadata definitions for software that are
associated with Nova instances (OS::Nova::Instance) which should
have their properties target set to "metadata".

The ability to add metadata to an instance leveraging these
definitions at launch time was recently added to horizon. In
a follow up discussion, somebody asked about using the metadata
definitions to also choose nova scheduler hints at launch time,
without confusing the two intended purposes of the metadata.
This raised our awareness that we don't have properties_target
set to "metadata" (rather than "scheduler hints") for
OS::Nova::Instance on the software metadata definition files.

This patch adds "properties_target": "metadata" to those files.

Change-Id: I247226ad78762d1d2add3bb39b1e780b93f36370
Closes-Bug: 1536849
'}]
commit_message:
Add properties_target to Instance SW metadefs

There are several metadata definitions for software that are
associated with Nova instances (OS::Nova::Instance) which should
have their properties target set to "metadata".

The ability to add metadata to an instance leveraging these
definitions at launch time was recently added to horizon. In
a follow up discussion, somebody asked about using the metadata
definitions to also choose nova scheduler hints at launch time,
without confusing the two intended purposes of the metadata.
This raised our awareness that we don't have properties_target
set to "metadata" (rather than "scheduler hints") for
OS::Nova::Instance on the software metadata definition files.

This patch adds "properties_target": "metadata" to those files.

Change-Id: I247226ad78762d1d2add3bb39b1e780b93f36370
Closes-Bug: 1536849

commit_message:
Update CI tasks and module fixtures

This change updates the fixtures files for the modules within
fuel-library to use the relative path to the upstream modules used by
fuel-library. With this change we are also adding an initial prep task
that is used by CI to pull down all the modules first and only one time
to reduce the amount of repeated calls to the upstream git repositories.

Included in this change is also an update to exclude all the upstream
modules from the spec and lint tasks as those are maintained in the
upstream modules and should not be done when testing fuel-library.

This change also adds documentation to the README.md on how to run the
tests from the root of fuel-library.

Change-Id: I9cde21b94a8367fd45cf046af48d7618076a385c
Related-Bug: #1535832

subject: neutron: enable ml2 mtu calculation mechanism
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-25 12:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ml2'], 'message': "neutron: enable ml2 mtu calculation mechanism

Setting path_mtu to reflect mtu for physical devices that handle traffic
issued from br-tun makes ml2 plugin to calculate mtu for tenant networks
properly, considering encapsulation headers. After that, calculated mtu
values can be propagated into instances (currently, only DHCP approach
is implemented; RA support for IPv6 subnets is under review).

This change allows to run tunnelled tenant networks in multinode when
underlying physical devices don't support jumbo frames.

Note: changing the default value in neutron would not be backwards
compatible, since it could slow down east-west tunnelled traffic in
clouds that run on jumbo-aware networks.

Change-Id: I8287677c7ad0f13fa9f5cb194f9372d04b78cb61
Related-Bug: #1527675
(cherry picked from commit 06cfce37560243d22cd05b2c620be6702528a0b1)
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: enable ml2 mtu calculation mechanism

Setting path_mtu to reflect mtu for physical devices that handle traffic
issued from br-tun makes ml2 plugin to calculate mtu for tenant networks
properly, considering encapsulation headers. After that, calculated mtu
values can be propagated into instances (currently, only DHCP approach
is implemented; RA support for IPv6 subnets is under review).

This change allows to run tunnelled tenant networks in multinode when
underlying physical devices don't support jumbo frames.

Note: changing the default value in neutron would not be backwards
compatible, since it could slow down east-west tunnelled traffic in
clouds that run on jumbo-aware networks.

Change-Id: I8287677c7ad0f13fa9f5cb194f9372d04b78cb61
Related-Bug: #1527675
(cherry picked from commit 06cfce37560243d22cd05b2c620be6702528a0b1)

subject: Tolerate inconsistent backup stack on delete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-06 18:15:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Tolerate inconsistent backup stack on delete

In some situations it's possible for the backup stack template and
environment to be inconsistent, such as when an in-progress update
is interrupted by an engine restart.  In this case, we need to
tolerate any validation failures, such as not-found TemplateResource
resources, or the stack becomes stuck and undeletable.

Change-Id: I119f6141060f591d6f04f3d1f6542b042e70ec2e
Closes-Bug: #1531547
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate inconsistent backup stack on delete

In some situations it's possible for the backup stack template and
environment to be inconsistent, such as when an in-progress update
is interrupted by an engine restart.  In this case, we need to
tolerate any validation failures, such as not-found TemplateResource
resources, or the stack becomes stuck and undeletable.

Change-Id: I119f6141060f591d6f04f3d1f6542b042e70ec2e

commit_message:
Fixes wording of exceptions for delete

Updated the wording of exceptions that prevent the deletion of
managed records. Original message indicated that user was
unable to update when the user actually requested a delete.
New message is "Managed records may not be deleted"
Both exceptions in designate/central/service.py

Change-Id: I27395999b2002374a74bddad71333f508354f37b
Closes-Bug: #1511230

commit_message:
Add 'workers' section into configuration doc

Workers has been introduced into Decision Engine and Applier.
We can now tune ithe number of workers (threads) used by the
Decision Engine and the Applier services, by updating the Watcher
configuration file.

Change-Id: I81523666e4373e7b1dd59b36daf19067fd61b48f
Closes-Bug: #1528132

commit_message:
Don't assign VIPs for GET requests

Since VIPs make no sense before a cluster is deployed
there's no need to assign them when network configuration
is generated for GET requests.

Co-authored by: Maciej Kwiek <mkwiek@mirantis.com>
Co-authored by: Roman Prykhodchenko <me@romcheg.me>

Change-Id: I56ba8e11883449b8c5ea6a2a3a8a122fc61e99f9
Closes-bug: #1504572
Closes-bug: #1499291
Partial-bug: #1524320

subject: Check whether agent tarball exists
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-21 07:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Check whether agent tarball exists

Currently, when execute devstack/stack.sh,
agent tarball is downloaded every time even if
it exists already.
This patch set
* checks whether kernel/ramdisk exists
and if there are, doesn't down load them.
* checks whether ironic agent kernel/ramdisk exists
and if there are, copy them.

Change-Id: Ic546ba8fc0cc14dc7cf13433e09db35a0854d115
Closes-Bug: #1533491
"}]
commit_message:
Check whether agent tarball exists

Currently, when execute devstack/stack.sh,
agent tarball is downloaded every time even if
it exists already.
This patch set
* checks whether kernel/ramdisk exists
and if there are, doesn't down load them.
* checks whether ironic agent kernel/ramdisk exists
and if there are, copy them.

Change-Id: Ic546ba8fc0cc14dc7cf13433e09db35a0854d115
Closes-Bug: #1533491

subject: Pass timeout through to floating ip creation
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-22 14:34:59.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Pass timeout through to floating ip creation

When we do create server, we have a timeout from the user for the
action. However, in auto_ip, the action can also mean creating a
floating ip which can timeout of its own accord. Pass in the remaining
time.

Change-Id: Ifffdb1d9c34235f5a1fa3b382b9820a579d5c37a
'}]
commit_message:
Pass timeout through to floating ip creation

When we do create server, we have a timeout from the user for the
action. However, in auto_ip, the action can also mean creating a
floating ip which can timeout of its own accord. Pass in the remaining
time.

Change-Id: Ifffdb1d9c34235f5a1fa3b382b9820a579d5c37a

commit_message:
Blacklist eventlet 0.18.0

The new release breaks all of nova-docs invocations, downgrading
eventlet to 0.17.4 fixes see.

Sample failure:
http://logs.openstack.org/50/254950/14/check/gate-nova-docs/ac9a9d9/console.html#_2016-01-23_19_52_50_272

Blacklist eventlet 0.18.0 for now to further investigate and unblock nova.

Change-Id: Iaef7877cf2bf3e64e5a053e9c43cd0550067449e

commit_message:
Drop pip-and-virtualenv element

The URL for get-pip.py is outdated and overriding
the functional element in DIB-proper. This is currently
affecting other projects depending on the tripleo service.

Closes-Bug: #1536844

subject: Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-08 07:41:25.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
 of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)

as well use it.

Change-Id: Ia11286978d81c85882b7a82f28eb5ab1fa860964
'}]
commit_message:
Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
 of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)
so its usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: Ia11286978d81c85882b7a82f28eb5ab1fa860964

subject: worlddump: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-24 16:48:18.000000000', 'files': ['tools/worlddump.py'], 'message': "worlddump: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

The function guru_meditation_report() currently uses the User-defined
signal SIGUSR1 to kill a Nova Compute process so that a Guru Meditation
Report is generated.

Testing locally, in a DevStack instance, manually attempting to kill a
Nova compute process [kill -s USR1 `pgrep nova-compute`] does not result
in process being terminated, and no error report generated.

It turns out[1] that SIGUSR1 is used by Apache 'mod_wsgi'.

Using the signal SIGUSR2 resolves this issue (i.e. 'nova-compute'
process is terminated, and the Guru Meditation Report is generated).

So, use USR2, instead of USR1.

Corresponding oslo.reports related commit[2].

[1] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIRestrictSignal
[2] 45b1c02d113051d147e54ef921ce8e94135542d8 -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1
[3] Original DevStack commit that brought in this change --
    2ebe993b25462919e8aeeb896c9f91b6be7aa573

Change-Id: I8a7eaf71b83edca3c80074d6bf2d471e3db6142b
"}]
commit_message:
worlddump: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

The function guru_meditation_report() currently uses the User-defined
signal SIGUSR1 to kill a Nova Compute process so that a Guru Meditation
Report is generated.

Testing locally, in a DevStack instance, manually attempting to kill a
Nova compute process [kill -s USR1 `pgrep nova-compute`] does not result
in process being terminated, and no error report generated.

It turns out[1] that SIGUSR1 is used by Apache 'mod_wsgi'.

Using the signal SIGUSR2 resolves this issue (i.e. 'nova-compute'
process is terminated, and the Guru Meditation Report is generated).

So, use USR2, instead of USR1.

Corresponding oslo.reports related commit[2].

[1] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIRestrictSignal
[2] 45b1c02d113051d147e54ef921ce8e94135542d8 -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1
[3] Original DevStack commit that brought in this change --
    2ebe993b25462919e8aeeb896c9f91b6be7aa573

Change-Id: I8a7eaf71b83edca3c80074d6bf2d471e3db6142b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-21 10:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/tools/tools.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/atop.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/classes/osnailyfacter_atop_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/templates/atop.erb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/spec_helper.rb'], 'message': 'Disable accounting procacct mode

Turn off process accounting ('no procacct' mode).
But atop still has an ability to collect valuable stats.

Bring in internal "custom_acct_file" option:
* false - use atop default accounting file
* /path_to/atop.acct - custom one
* undef - disable accounting procacct mode

DocImpact: 'custom_accounting_file' is system wide process
accounting file (valid values is above).

Change-Id: Ida00dc663dd8c6494c479de2ae2f0f7ab6014a84
Closes-Bug: #1530167
(cherry picked from commit 57911011587fbf24b9e68b2a67fc3f6d1bef967e)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable accounting procacct mode

Turn off process accounting ('no procacct' mode).
But atop still has an ability to collect valuable stats.

Bring in internal "custom_acct_file" option:
* false - use atop default accounting file
* /path_to/atop.acct - custom one
* undef - disable accounting procacct mode

DocImpact: 'custom_accounting_file' is system wide process
accounting file (valid values is above).

Change-Id: Ida00dc663dd8c6494c479de2ae2f0f7ab6014a84
Closes-Bug: #1530167
(cherry picked from commit 57911011587fbf24b9e68b2a67fc3f6d1bef967e)

Fix database_max_retries for Ironic services

Ironic services should try to connect to database infinity.

commit_message:
Use upstream puppetlabs-rabbitmq

We want no more downstream efforts for the module.
All patches shall be sent upstream only now.

Closes-bug: #1534560

Change-Id: I82753a625672635de2ddd340d60d7fbe344ad50a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Remove leftover homedir clouds.yaml files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-21 15:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Remove leftover homedir clouds.yaml files

We don't write files here anymore, but it's higher in the precedence
order than the /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml file we do write. Some
developers who have long-lived devstacks who update infrequently have
been bitten by the leftover file.

Change-Id: I8af6bd465f74099c560dddba6b5221dd79cbc965
"}]
commit_message:
Remove leftover homedir clouds.yaml files

We don't write files here anymore, but it's higher in the precedence
order than the /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml file we do write. Some
developers who have long-lived devstacks who update infrequently have
been bitten by the leftover file.

Change-Id: I8af6bd465f74099c560dddba6b5221dd79cbc965

commit_message:
Added doc8

For a better doc QoS, we now use doc8 as part of the testing
procedure while removing the existing tests we had on doc formatting.

I also updated tox.ini to run doc8 as within 'pep8' and 'docs' venvs.

Change-Id: Ia0ad99541509f4c026e26d28c41ff0210b12a504
Closes-Bug: #1524228

commit_message:
Switch fuel-library 3.8 to nonvoting

We are currently experiancing issues with the latest version of facter
under 3.8. This change is to switch the 3.8 unit jobs to nonvoting to
unblock CI while we research a complete solution.

Change-Id: Ief3c2e004c059c53b8a23c07dc1ad6a075052c7e

Changes APIPackageLoader class, to enable it to persist downloaded
packages on disc. Adds synchronization between eventlet threads and
different murano-engine workers, since it's now possible for
several engines to attempt to download the same package
The functionality is controlled with 'enable_package_cache' conf

commit_message:
Allow package cache to persist on disc

Changes APIPackageLoader class, to enable it to persist downloaded
packages on disc. Adds synchronization between eventlet threads and
different murano-engine workers, since it's now possible for
several engines to attempt to download the same package
The functionality is controlled with 'enable_package_cache' conf
variable.

Targets blueprint: murano-engine-package-cache

Change-Id: Ia7bc60ea44463724758c9313683c28b5d736bbd5

commit_message:
Revert the work-around for renaming PXE interface on Ubuntu bootstrap

The fix for the renaming interface used on PXE boot of Ubuntu
bootstrap is in the live-boot_4.0.2-1~u14.04+mos2 package.
We don't need this work-around any more. Related to the
LP #1529631 and LP #1528275.

Depends-On: I7ddc1ac41813747ae0285900a3540f39b89161cb
Change-Id: I4eaca76175e6df308b819c7f06ff057318f3115b
Related-Bug: #1529631
Related-Bug: #1528275
(cherry picked from commit 469b68b83be9dd2d5f3bf0b31fe3e63d875daa34)

subject: Hide duplicate titles and empty tocs in generated content
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-18 21:43:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/combined.css', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/layout.html', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/localtoc.html'], 'message': 'Hide duplicate titles and empty tocs in generated content

At the moment we have two h1 titles, in the content generated by
Sphinx and in the titlerow.html file. This change will hide the h1 title
in the generated content.

At the moment the title of a document is displayed in the local toc. This
change will hide the title of a document in the local toc.

At the moment the local toc is also displayed when it only contains the
title of the document. This change will not display the local toc if it
conly contains the title of the document.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-January/008180.html

Change-Id: I48b923a67010c92945c46ab00de0b090ba7cd465
'}]
commit_message:
Hide duplicate titles and empty tocs in generated content

At the moment we have two h1 titles, in the content generated by
Sphinx and in the titlerow.html file. This change will hide the h1 title
in the generated content.

At the moment the title of a document is displayed in the local toc. This
change will hide the title of a document in the local toc.

At the moment the local toc is also displayed when it only contains the
title of the document. This change will not display the local toc if it
conly contains the title of the document.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-January/008180.html

Change-Id: I48b923a67010c92945c46ab00de0b090ba7cd465

subject: Bump Kilo next version to 2015.1.4 & fix pip
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-24 15:10:05.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Bump Kilo next version to 2015.1.4 & fix pip

This bumps stable/kilo to next version but also squashes in
backport of commit:5f1f33cbc9f943f03c6557691508ef05886fcffd
which is needed to unblock CI as pip>=8 is wedged at
current.

pip has its own download cache by default

We no longer need tox to tell us to use one.

Note that this is a mandatory fix for use with pip>=8.

Change-Id: I1a1d3e6737276240761eb6d5f6e0b4b57b9f1965
'}]
commit_message:
Bump Kilo next version to 2015.1.4 & fix pip

This bumps stable/kilo to next version but also squashes in
backport of commit:5f1f33cbc9f943f03c6557691508ef05886fcffd
which is needed to unblock CI as pip>=8 is wedged at
current.

pip has its own download cache by default

We no longer need tox to tell us to use one.

Note that this is a mandatory fix for use with pip>=8.

Change-Id: I1a1d3e6737276240761eb6d5f6e0b4b57b9f1965

subject: Enable TLS endpoints through os-cloud-config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 14:31:10.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Enable TLS endpoints through os-cloud-config

Currently the way to configure keystone endpoints is through the
os-cloud-config scripts. This change enables the necessary parameters
in order to get os-cloud-config to configure the keystone endpoints
with TLS enabled. Even though setting up the endpoints in such a way
will be deprecated in favor of doing it through puppet, This patch
enabled a way of enabling TLS that can be backported.

Change-Id: Ie2428093b270ab8bc19fcb2130bb16a41ca0ce09
'}]
commit_message:
Enable TLS endpoints through os-cloud-config

Currently the way to configure keystone endpoints is through the
os-cloud-config scripts. This change enables the necessary parameters
in order to get os-cloud-config to configure the keystone endpoints
with TLS enabled. Even though setting up the endpoints in such a way
will be deprecated in favor of doing it through puppet, This patch
enabled a way of enabling TLS that can be backported.

Change-Id: Ie2428093b270ab8bc19fcb2130bb16a41ca0ce09

subject: Fix Mutable defalut argument
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 15:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['muranoagent/tests/unit/executors/test_puppet.py', 'muranoagent/tests/unit/test_script_runner.py', 'muranoagent/tests/unit/executors/test_chef.py'], 'message': 'Fix Mutable defalut argument

Python’s default arguments are evaluated once when the
function is defined, not each time the function is called.
This means that if you use a mutable default argument
and mutate it, you will and have mutated that object for
all future calls to the function as well.

more details about this wrong usage here:
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments

Change-Id: Ic8eb1328852eb8a3180a08466bf18b72fd1f7956
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Mutable defalut argument

Python’s default arguments are evaluated once when the
function is defined, not each time the function is called.
This means that if you use a mutable default argument
and mutate it, you will and have mutated that object for
all future calls to the function as well.

more details about this wrong usage here:
http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments

Change-Id: Ic8eb1328852eb8a3180a08466bf18b72fd1f7956

commit_message:
Vagrant: Adjust HOST_IP for compute nodes

Commit 58e1e35d450ceb55523ab21c5483a6a8793749d2 added an empty HOST_IP
to computenode-local.conf, which broke Vagrant because it resulted in
an invalid local.conf file on compute nodes. This corrects that problem
by ensuring we set HOST_IP for compute nodes in the Vagrant
configuration.

Change-Id: Ic2aaf56cdbecdd56f72fe30ed953246303230d7a
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Vagrant: Fix issue with boxes

This change gets "apt-get" working in the Vagrant boxes used for OVN.
Without this, all apt-get operations fail, and the boxes never deploy.
Appears to be an issue with all new Vagrant boxes I've tried in 2016
so far. We can remove this once it's fixed.

Change-Id: I8d71807190ce4b9002040846b01e1b4dd6f577f0
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
[Core-Library] Add ability to specify direction and ethetype for groups

Previously there was no way to specify in which direction security rule
should be applied, only ingress was supported. Also it was impossible
to create IPv6 rules.
This patch added ability to specify direction and ethertype for
Neutron security groups and direction - for AWS security groups

Change-Id: Iba5be7a8a94c34eab3e0e06f95e5358a84a5dd7b
Closes-Bug: #1532317
(cherry picked from commit 186612daf708b0ad3199bbf77ea8d3ed0f5eb48e)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-25 12:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_context/context.py'], 'message': 'Fix request_id type on Python 3: use text (Unicode)

generate_request_id() was previously modified by the change
I389cf20e4c999c9bb576a42388497852f8ba27ec to return a bytes string
instead of a text string. According to the author of the change, it
was a mistake (the right fix is to update the unit test, not modify
the tested function).

Having a request_id as a byte string is not convenient on Python 3.
For example, it's a bug to write '"id:%s" % request_id', a
BytesWarning exception is raised when python3 is run with -bb command
line option. It not possible to write str+bytes neither.

Right now, oslo_log emits logs with b'...' which is unexpected. I
prefer to fix the issue in oslo_context rather than working around
the issue in oslo_log. Example of log emitted on Python 3:

"WARNING glance.api.v2.tasks [b'req-83a6...' 54492... - - -] ..."

This change depends on changes in Glance, Neutron and oslo.middleware
which prepares unit tests to support bytes and str request_id. So
their unit tests will work on the old and new versions of
oslo.context. Changes on unit tests are required for the master
branch but also Liberty because their python34 check job is voting on
Liberty and master.

This change depends on the following changes:

* change Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9
* change Ia5203581db120bb4f8e24fd752d6ae14e6558505
* change I872c268ef5f17dc2c1fe0ce8aa7e8af4ebc1d757
* change Ia4df8f05d5746887eb99bbf368d29e8d30a3a90a

Closes-Bug: #1526662
Change-Id: If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix request_id type on Python 3: use text (Unicode)

generate_request_id() was previously modified by the change
I389cf20e4c999c9bb576a42388497852f8ba27ec to return a bytes string
instead of a text string. According to the author of the change, it
was a mistake (the right fix is to update the unit test, not modify
the tested function).

Having a request_id as a byte string is not convenient on Python 3.
For example, it's a bug to write '"id:%s" % request_id', a
BytesWarning exception is raised when python3 is run with -bb command
line option. It not possible to write str+bytes neither.

Right now, oslo_log emits logs with b'...' which is unexpected. I
prefer to fix the issue in oslo_context rather than working around
the issue in oslo_log. Example of log emitted on Python 3:

"WARNING glance.api.v2.tasks [b'req-83a6...' 54492... - - -] ..."

This change depends on changes in Glance, Neutron and oslo.middleware
which prepares unit tests to support bytes and str request_id. So
their unit tests will work on the old and new versions of
oslo.context. Changes on unit tests are required for the master
branch but also Liberty because their python34 check job is voting on
Liberty and master.

This change depends on the following changes:

* change Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9
* change Ia5203581db120bb4f8e24fd752d6ae14e6558505
* change I872c268ef5f17dc2c1fe0ce8aa7e8af4ebc1d757
* change Ia4df8f05d5746887eb99bbf368d29e8d30a3a90a

Closes-Bug: #1526662
Change-Id: If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f

test_preview_update only create one stack per test

wastes some time (as much as 20s locally, probably much more in the
gate), so instead just create one stack per test.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 15942, 'name': 'Dell EMC Isilon CI', 'email': 'emc.isilon.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'e', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-23 18:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Largeops should use no-op nova NETWORK_MANAGER

largeops uses Nova's fake virt driver by design. However
the default NETWORK_MANAGER in devstack still is FlatDHCPManager.
FlatDHCPManager starts/stops/manages dnsmasq process to hand out
DHCP leases to vm(s). In the large ops scenario, this is really
useless. We are basically testing parts of nova-network here by using
FlatDHCPManager and since we don't really start/stop any real vm(s)
we really don't need to test FlatDHCPManager at all in the
large ops scenario.

Related-Bug: #1500615
Related-Bug: #1491949
Change-Id: I1df5e0eaf2fef8e6733a52296c02c221eb167ce0
"}]
commit_message:
Largeops should use no-op nova NETWORK_MANAGER

largeops uses Nova's fake virt driver by design. However
the default NETWORK_MANAGER in devstack still is FlatDHCPManager.
FlatDHCPManager starts/stops/manages dnsmasq process to hand out
DHCP leases to vm(s). In the large ops scenario, this is really
useless. We are basically testing parts of nova-network here by using
FlatDHCPManager and since we don't really start/stop any real vm(s)
we really don't need to test FlatDHCPManager at all in the
large ops scenario.

Related-Bug: #1500615
Related-Bug: #1491949
Change-Id: I1df5e0eaf2fef8e6733a52296c02c221eb167ce0

commit_message:
Config file updater use current code

The config file updater has proposed some changes that conflict with
the current repository. This indicates that it's not using the
latest version of the branch for whatever reason.

This change makes sure the latest version of the code is checked
out before generating the sample config file.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/264346/

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I3424d529c568f0a9570a757cc6e85155b0645d4b
Closes-bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Replace exit() by sys.exit()

exit() is used for interactive shell, it relies on the site module.
sys.exit() is considered good to use in programs.

Trivial-fix

Change-Id: Ic34e137a4f1d116a63f50a56ee6b3b2d5efa6d97

The workflow service type should be workflowv2

The default upstream service type for Mistral
should now be 'workflowv2'.

See mistralclient here:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-mistralclient/tree/mistralclient/shell.py#n208

don't source openrc

source it as it prevents some ip math errors from randomly killing
tests.

commit_message:
Fix bug with large report processing

Murano CI fails to generate HTML report if XML report file
is larger than 9M. It was caused by missing huge_tree parameter
for lxml parser.

Change-Id: I65d746a5d978b1072bbcfcdeb57c2cbfa4813099

will forget the queues and messages. To make sure those
messages aren't lost, amqp_durable_quesesneed to added in

Change-Id: I35b3897bb56ebcc955bb15d19465493549dec69b
Closes-Bug: #1537354

commit_message:
Adding amqp_durable_queues parameter to ceilometer

amqp_durable_queues is an important param for configuring
Rabbitmq HA, When rabbitmq service quits or crashes,it
will forget the queues and messages. To make sure those
messages aren't lost, amqp_durable_quesesneed to added in
ceilometer.

Change-Id: I35b3897bb56ebcc955bb15d19465493549dec69b
Closes-Bug: #1537354

commit_message:
Add environment template clone

There is a clone template operation in murano API. In order to
launch the operation you need a operation for this action.
In addition, is mandatory to add is-public parameter to create operation.

Change-Id: I4bd38bf2a0da5654bcbf0c9f3e0182f3d21b2532
Implements: blueprint template-clone

subject: Remove argparse from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-20 17:22:52.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/fuelmenu.py'], 'message': 'Do not update console loglevel

The flow of kernel messages breaks the look of fuel-menu. To work around
it, fuel-menu updates the kernel.printk sysctl to suppress them being
printed to the console (restoring the original value upon the exit).

A better way is updating this variable outside fuel-menu so more
components could benefit from it.

This patch removes the code that changes printk from fuel-menu.

Change-Id: I62dd9c1db19cc9f3a74fd08c80d441ed8cf22692
Depends-On: If6c65a08c83e9ff5b4a828e2a45c34c78e571e72
Closes-Bug: #1535419
'}]
commit_message:
Do not update console loglevel

The flow of kernel messages breaks the look of fuel-menu. To work around
it, fuel-menu updates the kernel.printk sysctl to suppress them being
printed to the console (restoring the original value upon the exit).

A better way is updating this variable outside fuel-menu so more
components could benefit from it.

This patch removes the code that changes printk from fuel-menu.

Change-Id: I62dd9c1db19cc9f3a74fd08c80d441ed8cf22692
Depends-On: If6c65a08c83e9ff5b4a828e2a45c34c78e571e72
Closes-Bug: #1535419

subject: Add liberasurecode-dev as a swift dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-25 11:54:16.000000000', 'files': ['files/debs/swift', 'files/rpms-suse/swift', 'files/rpms/swift'], 'message': "Add liberasurecode-dev as a swift dependency

Swift requirement PyECLib won't bundle liberasurecode
going forward given the package is available in common
distros now.  This patch adds liberasurecode-dev(el)
package to the devstack debs/rpms list for Swift as a
PyECLib build/install dependency.

Change-Id: Idbc2ca3f677f1b8153ebf3a5912f4354525a55c7
(cherry picked from commit 2960bfa7f63c26d94c8aed2c3e1a6ff039b530f0)
"}]
commit_message:
Add liberasurecode-dev as a swift dependency

Swift requirement PyECLib won't bundle liberasurecode
going forward given the package is available in common
distros now.  This patch adds liberasurecode-dev(el)
package to the devstack debs/rpms list for Swift as a
PyECLib build/install dependency.

Change-Id: Idbc2ca3f677f1b8153ebf3a5912f4354525a55c7
(cherry picked from commit 2960bfa7f63c26d94c8aed2c3e1a6ff039b530f0)

commit_message:
Tweak MySQL logging configuration

For a galera replication we do not need binary logs, but we need binary logs in
case customer needs to perform MySQL backup. In this review we propose to limit
rotation period for 1 day, and set option to disable binary logging by default.

Closes-Bug: #1533805
(cherry picked from commit 9660e49bdf8229418450c9a1151ab217d357a797)

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/galera/manifests/init.pp
	tests/noop/spec/hosts/database/database_spec.rb

Change-Id: I001c87081a3b334eb8844abca60e468370ea5f24

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 08:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/pacemaker_wrappers/manifests/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Enable migration of rabbitmq resource on failure

RabbitMQ resource in pacemaker was never migrating
due to numerous failures. Now it will fail under
the following circumstances:
* Over 10 failures (was INFINITY)
* Fails for over 30s (was 360s)

Also enabled resource stickiness (was 0) to reduce
likelihood of moving RabbitMQ master back to the
failed host.

Change-Id: I016b7b2ca01ede7ebdd07c06f685299b2654ac8a
Closes-Bug: #1490941
(cherry picked from commit 48e2c672077a438cf138b45830d6ecaa49e9444b)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable migration of rabbitmq resource on failure

RabbitMQ resource in pacemaker was never migrating
due to numerous failures. Now it will fail under
the following circumstances:
* Over 10 failures (was INFINITY)
* Fails for over 30s (was 360s)

Also enabled resource stickiness (was 0) to reduce
likelihood of moving RabbitMQ master back to the
failed host.

Change-Id: I016b7b2ca01ede7ebdd07c06f685299b2654ac8a
Closes-Bug: #1490941
(cherry picked from commit 48e2c672077a438cf138b45830d6ecaa49e9444b)

Change-Id: Idbc2ca3f677f1b8153ebf3a5912f4354525a55c7

commit_message:
Add liberasurecode-dev as a swift dependency

Swift requirement PyECLib won't bundle liberasurecode
going forward given the package is available in common
distros now.  This patch adds liberasurecode-dev(el)
package to the devstack debs/rpms list for Swift as a
PyECLib build/install dependency.

Change-Id: Idbc2ca3f677f1b8153ebf3a5912f4354525a55c7

commit_message:
Filter out deployments with None config

Filter the deployments with  None config when pushing deployment
metadata.

commit_message:
Increase kernel.pid_max value for ceph-osd nodes

To meet Ceph requirements and eliminate accidental cascade
OSD node failures this commit increases kernel.pid_max
parameter during deploy ceph-osd nodes. Also this commit
contain some puppet-lint cleanups and validations for this
module.

Change-Id: I70a64ff7b85229bf0760be266302d9b32039989a
Closes-Bug: #1536271
Closes-Bug: #1537084

Add translation for log messages

LOG.error messages require translations `_LE()`
LOG.warning messages require translations `_LW()`
LOG.info messages require translations `_LI()`

commit_message:
make large-ops jobs non voting

Something happened in the last 24 hours to make these jobs spike
really hard:

http://tinyurl.com/j5u4nf5

We are already in the middle of a pip release break, and multinode
test breaks, and dhcp breaks. This just makes it impossible to land
fixes.

We should make this non-voting until we can get this under control.

Change-Id: I3f805d0bbbd1922606ad9a893aa8b7286135eedc

commit_message:
WIP: separate ApiSamplesEngine from api samples test classes

This attempts to pull the ApiSamplesEngine out of the test hierarchy
so that interactions with it can be a lot more proscriptive. It's part
of what's needed to collapse the API samples tests hierarchy.

Not yet passing tests, still very much a mess. But a start.

Change-Id: I9124430bd812f90bee2c410bc7147ed2973ab6c5

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-06 00:50:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/images.py'], 'message': "DNM: super duper ghetto glance conversion to SC

This is a fast hack and slash POC in what has to change to get nova to
use glance from the service catalog instead of from the config
file. It works well enough that 'nova image-list' functions on
libvirt/kvm (which should have tickled the majority of the bits that
matter)

To do this for real this would need a deprecation of existing values,
it would need a way to continue to generate the direct to glance links
(we're currently missing a context in the image view for this, that
would need to change). Also lots of testing.

Change-Id: I0893828686709bb424491eb445e9307dac87d1ec
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: super duper ghetto glance conversion to SC

This is a fast hack and slash POC in what has to change to get nova to
use glance from the service catalog instead of from the config
file. It works well enough that 'nova image-list' functions on
libvirt/kvm (which should have tickled the majority of the bits that
matter)

To do this for real this would need a deprecation of existing values,
it would need a way to continue to generate the direct to glance links
(we're currently missing a context in the image view for this, that
would need to change). Also lots of testing.

Change-Id: I0893828686709bb424491eb445e9307dac87d1ec

subject: Fix update preview to consider type comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 11:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_update.py'], 'message': 'Fix update preview to consider type comparison

Currently the update preview code only considers _needs_update, but
the actual update code does a type comparison which is used to decide
whether to attempt an in-place update vs a replacement.

Thus, we currently erroneously say a resource is either unchanged or
updated during update --dry-run when the type changes, but during
the actual update we replace the resource.  So instead use the same
type comparison used during update to provide a more accurate preview.

Change-Id: Idb2d9a55d47748007a438f84bb1f2259e553c067
Partial-Bug: #1521971
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update preview to consider type comparison

Currently the update preview code only considers _needs_update, but
the actual update code does a type comparison which is used to decide
whether to attempt an in-place update vs a replacement.

Thus, we currently erroneously say a resource is either unchanged or
updated during update --dry-run when the type changes, but during
the actual update we replace the resource.  So instead use the same
type comparison used during update to provide a more accurate preview.

Change-Id: Idb2d9a55d47748007a438f84bb1f2259e553c067
Partial-Bug: #1521971

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-08 15:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "collect service failures even when not under screen

When not running under screen we end up potentially missing some
services not starting because we don't check that they actually
started and write out error logs.

We mitigate this by ensuring that pids we believe should be running, are at
the end of the run.  This does potentially have a race on pid wrapping, but
it is a 95% solution that will help us identify some breaks.

Change-Id: I4dc7b956024fb03f4db59b0a7654ae5cd12bd206
Closes-Bug: #1504118
"}]
commit_message:
collect service failures even when not under screen

When not running under screen we end up potentially missing some
services not starting because we don't check that they actually
started and write out error logs.

We mitigate this by ensuring that pids we believe should be running, are at
the end of the run.  This does potentially have a race on pid wrapping, but
it is a 95% solution that will help us identify some breaks.

Change-Id: I4dc7b956024fb03f4db59b0a7654ae5cd12bd206
Closes-Bug: #1504118

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-13 10:04:42.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/prevention-of-401-in-swift-driver.rst'], 'message': 'Prevention of Unauthorized errors in Swift driver

This change proposal introduces a new mechanism for uploading/downloading
chunked files to Swift store, that prevents possible 401 errors if user
token expires during the operation. It helps to improve the reliability
of image uploads and downloads by providing the ability to reauthenticate
during the process, thereby enhancing the stability of the entire system.

Implements bp prevention-of-401-in-swift-driver

Change-Id: Ib18b626b7545c26d2c96c94db78030a80214e18e
'}]
commit_message:
Prevention of Unauthorized errors in Swift driver

This change proposal introduces a new mechanism for uploading/downloading
chunked files to Swift store, that prevents possible 401 errors if user
token expires during the operation. It helps to improve the reliability
of image uploads and downloads by providing the ability to reauthenticate
during the process, thereby enhancing the stability of the entire system.

Implements bp prevention-of-401-in-swift-driver

Change-Id: Ib18b626b7545c26d2c96c94db78030a80214e18e

commit_message:
Where filter is not done correctly on programmatic selection

The call here attempting to filter on id is incorrect. The
extra argument in the original is simply thrown away. The
result is the same since there is only a single record, however
it should be fixed.

Change-Id: I57a15a80d5e4b85ea636e017ecf2808514c0f38f

by setting RANDFILE to do it.

'}]
commit_message:
Declare RANDFILE to avoid issues with unable to write it

Remove error "unable to write 'random state'", cause by default
there is no explicit home to set it and remove 'PRNG not seeded'
by setting RANDFILE to do it.

Also lower dhparam size to avoid 'execution expired' errors.

Change-Id: I15993f8971ad0a03e1d8cb4a9ead806ee576925d
Closes-Bug: #1536608

commit_message:
Fix duplicate parameters and drop mock

This change removes the duplicate parameters from the main ironic class.
With the update to 3.8.5, this now shows up as a syntax error in the
syntax jobs. We should only define these parameters once.

Also mock is not used anywhere in the module, let's drop it.
This patch will help to hit this bug:
https://launchpad.net/bugs/1492636

Change-Id: Iaa6acafdc771118c74f85f3332f01b58d233743b
Closes-Bug: #1537251
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

commit_message:
auth_token verify revocation by audit_id

If the revocation list includes audit_ids, then when doing offline
validation also validate the token isn't revoked by audit_id.

Backport notes:
- test_auth_token_middleware was refactored with commit 9cbd47b to
  check responses differently, so the test changed to use the old
  method.
- reno was not supported so the release note is removed.

Closes-Bug: 1490804
Conflicts:
	keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py

(cherry picked from commit 96ab58e6863c92575ada57615b19652e502adfd8)
Change-Id: I483bc57bd38eb81a0905bcaf94e4ea82604919d6

commit_message:
[Core-Library] Add ability to specify direction and ethetype for groups

Previously there was no way to specify in which direction security rule
should be applied, only ingress was supported. Also it was impossible
to create IPv6 rules.
This patch added ability to specify direction and ethertype for
Neutron security groups and direction - for AWS security groups

Change-Id: Iba5be7a8a94c34eab3e0e06f95e5358a84a5dd7b
Closes-Bug: #1532317

So far, GlusterManager.gluster_call was directly calling

error type is ProcessExecutionError; while practically in

commit_message:
gluster*: refactor gluster_call

So far, GlusterManager.gluster_call was directly calling
into the given execution function, of which the expected
error type is ProcessExecutionError; while practically in
all use cases we wanted to raise upwards a GlusterfsException,
so all use cases were individually coercing the
ProcessExecutionError into a GlusterfsException. This produced
a huge amount of excess boilerplate code.

Here we include the coercion in the definiton of gluster_call
and clean out the excess code.

Partially implements bp gluster-code-cleanup

Change-Id: I0ad0478393df2cbb6d077363ebd6b91ceed21679

subject: only make token invalid when it really is
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-16 01:46:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_exceptions.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_identity.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py'], 'message': 'only make token invalid when it really is

The auth_token middleware was marking a token invalid in the cache
on any otherwise-uncaught exception, not only when it has really
determined that the token is invalid. This will fix that by being
better about using the InvalidToken exception only when the token is
really invalid, and only marking invalid in the cache when that
exception occurs.

This fix uncovered a bug in the auth_token unit test
test_composite_auth_delay_invalid_service_and_user_tokens, so that has
been addressed as well. It was attempting to use "invalid-user-token",
which was not initialized, where it meant to use "invalid-token". This
was leading to a NoMockAddress exception. Prior to this fix, the code
turned all unexpected exceptions into InvalidToken exceptions, masking
this issue.

It also uncovered DeprecationWarnings raised in _identity.py for usage
of logging.warn rather than logging.warning in py34. That has also
been fixed. As above, prior to this fix those would have been turned
into InvalidToken exceptions (incorrectly).

Closes-Bug: #1488267
(cherry picked from commit 7dcbdf774803a92bfc24704dec5f919ac75ad315)
(cherry picked from commit 75fbc5910afad5d6dbce5506cf9b38f793a68644)

Conflicts:
	keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py
	keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_identity.py
	keystonemiddleware/tests/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py

Cherry-Pick Note: The main conflict here is that webob is not used in
this version of auth_token middleware and so you can't simply raise a
500/503 error from deep in the code and expect it to be handled.
Currently the ServiceError handles the 503 exception. I added a
_InternalServiceError exception that does the same job as the similar
webob exception.

Change-Id: I2e487fb02c9171f743ecc1f4f230b29a5e96212d
'}]
commit_message:
only make token invalid when it really is

The auth_token middleware was marking a token invalid in the cache
on any otherwise-uncaught exception, not only when it has really
determined that the token is invalid. This will fix that by being
better about using the InvalidToken exception only when the token is
really invalid, and only marking invalid in the cache when that
exception occurs.

This fix uncovered a bug in the auth_token unit test
test_composite_auth_delay_invalid_service_and_user_tokens, so that has
been addressed as well. It was attempting to use "invalid-user-token",
which was not initialized, where it meant to use "invalid-token". This
was leading to a NoMockAddress exception. Prior to this fix, the code
turned all unexpected exceptions into InvalidToken exceptions, masking
this issue.

It also uncovered DeprecationWarnings raised in _identity.py for usage
of logging.warn rather than logging.warning in py34. That has also
been fixed. As above, prior to this fix those would have been turned
into InvalidToken exceptions (incorrectly).

Closes-Bug: #1488267
(cherry picked from commit 7dcbdf774803a92bfc24704dec5f919ac75ad315)
(cherry picked from commit 75fbc5910afad5d6dbce5506cf9b38f793a68644)

Conflicts:
	keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py
	keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_identity.py
	keystonemiddleware/tests/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py

Cherry-Pick Note: The main conflict here is that webob is not used in
this version of auth_token middleware and so you can't simply raise a
500/503 error from deep in the code and expect it to be handled.
Currently the ServiceError handles the 503 exception. I added a
_InternalServiceError exception that does the same job as the similar
webob exception.

Change-Id: I2e487fb02c9171f743ecc1f4f230b29a5e96212d

commit_message:
SSL/Cinder: enable ssl_header_handler filter

Enable oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory in
ssl_header_handler middlewarefilter so we can run Nova API with SSL
support.

Change-Id: If88dcdf9f4905e2a792b2fdc656eab51c85f637e

commit_message:
Replace yaml with fuelmenu module as yaml parser

This patch's mission is to wipe out unnecessary import from fuelmenu
module, in other case, these lines may be failed due to changes in
fuelmenu module and it will take a lot of effort to fast identify it.

Change-Id: Ib696846892fa3661c25d7e779392688c1240c553
Related-Bug: #1502110

commit_message:

Use the positional library instead of the local copy of the code.
This will prevent duplicating code across repositories without
needing to chase down weird dependency graphs.

Don't allow specify fixed_ip and port at the same time

Nova doesn't allow specify fixed_ip and port when create
server, so add the validation in heat.

Partial-Bug: #1533074

The patch checks that location value is present in image meta

Change-Id: I8f3640276368292ced508d5f4c918c147b9d1f19
Closes-Bug: #1498460
'}]
commit_message:
Validate empty location value for v1 api

When empty string is passed as location value the glance
raises internal server error.
The patch checks that location value is present in image meta
and generates BadRequest if it is empty.

Change-Id: I8f3640276368292ced508d5f4c918c147b9d1f19
Closes-Bug: #1498460

commit_message:
Revert "Pass environment variables of proxy to tox"

It looks like you can work around this problem by setting an 
environment variable on your dev system. See 
https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/config.html#confval-passenv=SPACE-SEPARATED-GLOBNAMES

This reverts commit b9ca1d534456aecfd4fd5caac053d4b1b49e231d.

Change-Id: Ib051f0a9f1b4277548c9473bfaed5db7b1bb18e1
